info.title: SKA-DLM: Request Manager REST API
info.description: REST interface of the SKA-DLM Request Manager

get.description:
Query a data_item.

At least one of item_name, oid, uid, or params is required.

parameters.name: item_name

schema.description: could be empty, in which case the first 1000 items are returned.
schema.title: Item Name

parameters.description: could be empty, in which case the first 1000 items are returned.

parameters.name: oid

schema.description: Return data_items referred to by the OID provided.
schema.title: Oid

parameters.description: Return data_items referred to by the OID provided.

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: Return data_item referred to by the UID provided.
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: Return data_item referred to by the UID provided.

parameters.name: storage_id

schema.description: Return data_item referred to by a given storage_id.
schema.title: Storage Id

parameters.description: Return data_item referred to by a given storage_id.

parameters.name: params

schema.description: specify the query parameters
schema.title: Params

parameters.description: specify the query parameters

patch.description:
Update fields of an existing data_item.

This is mostly used by the other convenience functions. In general when specifying
an OID or an item_name, multiple entries will be updated at the same time.

parameters.name: item_name

schema.description: the name of the data_items to be updated
schema.title: Item Name

parameters.description: the name of the data_items to be updated

parameters.name: oid

schema.description: the OID of the data_items to be updated
schema.title: Oid

parameters.description: the OID of the data_items to be updated

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated

schema.description: the json formatted update data, compatible with postgREST
schema.title: Post Data

patch.description: Set the URI field of the uid data_item.

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: the uid of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: the uid of the data_item to be updated

parameters.name: uri

schema.description: the access URI for the data_item
schema.title: Uri

parameters.description: the access URI for the data_item

parameters.name: storage_id

schema.description: the storage_id associated with the URI
schema.title: Storage Id

parameters.description: the storage_id associated with the URI

patch.description: Populate the metadata column for a data_item with the metadata.

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated

schema.description: a metadata JSON string
schema.title: Metadata Post

patch.description: Set the state field of the uid data_item.

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: the uid of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: the uid of the data_item to be updated

parameters.name: state

schema.description: the new state for the data_item
schema.title: State

parameters.description: the new state for the data_item

patch.description: Set the oid_expiration field of the data_items with the given OID.

parameters.name: oid

schema.description: the oid of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Oid

parameters.description: the oid of the data_item to be updated

parameters.name: expiration

schema.description: the expiration date for the data_item
schema.title: Expiration

parameters.description: the expiration date for the data_item

patch.description: Set the uid_expiration field of the data_item with the given UID.

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated

parameters.name: expiration

schema.description: the expiration date for the data_item
schema.title: Expiration

parameters.description: the expiration date for the data_item

patch.description: Set the user field of the data_item(s) with the given OID or UID.

parameters.name: oid

schema.description: the OID of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Oid

parameters.description: the OID of the data_item to be updated

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated

parameters.name: user

schema.description: the user for the data_item
schema.title: User

parameters.description: the user for the data_item

patch.description: Set the user field of the data_item(s) with the given OID or UID.

parameters.name: oid

schema.description: the OID of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Oid

parameters.description: the OID of the data_item to be updated

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated

parameters.name: group

schema.description: the group for the data_item
schema.title: Group

parameters.description: the group for the data_item

patch.description: Set the user field of the data_item(s) with the given OID or UID.

parameters.name: oid

schema.description: the OID of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Oid

parameters.description: the OID of the data_item to be updated

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated

parameters.name: acl

schema.description: the acl dict for the data_item
schema.title: Acl

patch.description: Set the phase field of the data_item(s) with given UID.

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: the UID of the data_item to be updated

parameters.name: phase

schema.description: the phase for the data_item
schema.title: Phase

parameters.description: the phase for the data_item

patch.description:
Update/set the item_tags field of a data_item with given item_name/OID.

This will update all records for a data_item at the same time.
Updating a single UID does not make sense.

parameters.name: item_name

schema.description: the name of the data_item
schema.title: Item Name

parameters.description: the name of the data_item

parameters.name: oid

schema.description: the OID of the data_item to be updated
schema.title: Oid

parameters.description: the OID of the data_item to be updated

schema.description: dictionary of keyword/value pairs
schema.title: Item Tags

get.description: Query for all expired data_items using the uid_expiration timestamp.

parameters.name: offset

schema.description: optional offset for the query
schema.title: Offset

parameters.description: optional offset for the query

get.description: Query for all deleted data_items using the deleted state.

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: The UID to be checked, optional.
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: The UID to be checked, optional.

get.description: Query for all data_items newer than the date provided.

parameters.name: check_date

schema.description: the UTC starting date (exclusive)
schema.title: Check Date

parameters.description: the UTC starting date (exclusive)

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: The UID to be checked, optional.
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: The UID to be checked, optional.

get.description: Query to check for existence of a data_item.

parameters.name: item_name

schema.description: optional item_name
schema.title: Item Name

parameters.description: optional item_name

parameters.name: oid

schema.description: the oid to be searched for
schema.title: Oid

parameters.description: the oid to be searched for

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: this returns only one storage_id
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: this returns only one storage_id

parameters.name: ready

schema.description: whether the item must be in ready state.
schema.title: Ready

parameters.description: whether the item must be in ready state.

get.description: Check whether a data_item exists and is in ready state.

parameters.name: item_name

schema.description: optional item_name
schema.title: Item Name

parameters.description: optional item_name

parameters.name: oid

schema.description: the oid to be searched for
schema.title: Oid

parameters.description: the oid to be searched for

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: this returns only one storage_id
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: this returns only one storage_id

get.description:
Query for the storage_ids of all backends holding a copy of a data_item.

Either an item_name or a OID have to be provided.

parameters.name: item_name

schema.description: optional item_name
schema.title: Item Name

parameters.description: optional item_name

parameters.name: oid

schema.description: the oid to be searched for
schema.title: Oid

parameters.description: the oid to be searched for

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: this returns only one storage_id
schema.title: Uid

parameters.description: this returns only one storage_id
